issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: The product is working as designed.
resolution.name: Not a Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
It appears the euwatch-describe-alarms command is not using the monitoring-url value in my euca2ools config.

I have this euca2ools configuration:
{code:title=/etc/euca2ools/conf.d/hp-aw2-2.ini}
; Eucalyptus Region hp-aw2-2

[region hp-aw2-2]
autoscaling-url = https://autoscaling.hp-aw2-2.hpcloudsvc.com/services/AutoScaling
cloudformation-url = https://cloudformation.hp-aw2-2.hpcloudsvc.com/services/CloudFormation
ec2-url = https://compute.hp-aw2-2.hpcloudsvc.com/services/compute
elasticloadbalancing-url = https://loadbalancing.hp-aw2-2.hpcloudsvc.com/services/LoadBalancing
iam-url = https://euare.hp-aw2-2.hpcloudsvc.com/services/Euare
monitoring-url https://cloudwatch.hp-aw2-2.hpcloudsvc.com/services/CloudWatch
s3-url = https://objectstorage.hp-aw2-2.hpcloudsvc.com/services/objectstorage
sts-url = https://tokens.hp-aw2-2.hpcloudsvc.com/services/Tokens
swf-url = https://simpleworkflow.hp-aw2-2.hpcloudsvc.com/services/SimpleWorkflow
user = admin

certificate = /usr/share/euca2ools/certs/cert-hp-aw2-2.pem
verify-ssl = false
{code}

{code:title=~/.euca/hp-aw2-2.ini}
; Eucalyptus Region hp-aw2-2

[user hp-aw2-2-admin]
account-id = XXXXXXXXXXXX
key-id = XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX
secret-key = XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX
{code}

If I run this command: 
{code}euwatch-describe-alarms --region=hp-aw2-2-admin@hp-aw2-2{code}
I get this result:
{code}euwatch-describe-alarms: error: No monitoring endpoint to connect to was given. Configured regions with monitoring endpoints are: aws:ap-northeast-1, aws:ap-southeast-1, aws:ap-southeast-2, aws:cn-north-1, aws:eu-west-1, aws:sa-east-1, aws:us-east-1, aws:us-gov-west-1, aws:us-west-1, aws:us-west-2, ecc{code}

if I create this environment variable before running the command:
{code}
export AWS_CLOUDWATCH_URL=https://cloudwatch.hp-aw2-2.hpcloudsvc.com
euwatch-describe-alarms --region=hp-aw2-2-admin@hp-aw2-2
{code}

I get expected results. 

I use this same 2-part split of region vs users config for all other services with no problems - this is the first time I've hit this with euca2ools. For example this works:
{code}euca-describe-keypairs --region hp-aw2-2-admin@hp-aw2-2{code}

Best guess is, something in the euwatch environment configuration logic is reading the files /etc/euca2ools/conf.d/aws.ini, /etc/euca2ools/conf.d/ecc.ini and /etc/euca2ools/conf.d/localhost.ini, but not reading other files in that same directory where I've placed per-region endpoint definitions similar to ecc.ini works. I would have thought that was shared logic across all commands, but so far this seems isolated to this one. I haven't tried other euwatch-* commands to see if it affects other commands in CloudWatch.

I have a workaround in the near term of adding the environment variable, so filing this as minor, but please fix this so I can remove that ugly workaround.
fields.summary: euwatch-describe-alarms does not appear to use monitoring-url in config ini file
fields.environment: I've confirmed this bug on Mac OS X Yosemite and CentOS 7.1.

comments.body: Would you please include --debug output for the command that failed?

Here's output from euwatch-describe-alarms which has the problem, followed by output from euca-describe-keypairs which does not. Both use the same method of configuring the region endpoints in /etc/euca2ools/conf.d/hp-aw2-1.ini, and the region users in ~/.euca/hp-aw2-1.ini.

FYI: I hit this while converting one of my demo scripts in the euca-demo project to my latest conventions, which involved a switch from sourcing a eucarc file and relying on admin-level credentials passed via the environment, to not sourcing any eucarc files but instead configuring euca2ools in a manner similar to aws or ecc regions and passing in --region USER@REGION explicitly. This is needed for some demos which jump back and forth between AWS and Euca regions, but I just decided to use that pattern everywhere. I should complete that conversion today and will know if any other services are affected, as this demo hits most services. But this is the first time I've hit it despite using this explicit method for months across most of the other services.

hpmcrawford01:bin mcrawford$ *{color:#59afe1}euwatch-describe-alarms --region hp-aw2-1-admin@hp-aw2-1 --debug{color}*

What does the "region" portion of hp-aw2-1.ini contain?

Here's the complete contents of both relevant configuration files, with secret-keys redacted:

{code:title=cat /etc/euca2ools/conf.d/hp-aw2-1.ini}
; Eucalyptus Region hp-aw2-1

[region hp-aw2-1]
autoscaling-url = https://autoscaling.hp-aw2-1.hpcloudsvc.com/services/AutoScaling
cloudformation-url = https://cloudformation.hp-aw2-1.hpcloudsvc.com/services/CloudFormation
ec2-url = https://compute.hp-aw2-1.hpcloudsvc.com/services/compute
elasticloadbalancing-url = https://loadbalancing.hp-aw2-1.hpcloudsvc.com/services/LoadBalancing
iam-url = https://euare.hp-aw2-1.hpcloudsvc.com/services/Euare
monitoring-url https://cloudwatch.hp-aw2-1.hpcloudsvc.com/services/CloudWatch
s3-url = https://objectstorage.hp-aw2-1.hpcloudsvc.com/services/objectstorage
sts-url = https://tokens.hp-aw2-1.hpcloudsvc.com/services/Tokens
swf-url = https://simpleworkflow.hp-aw2-1.hpcloudsvc.com/services/SimpleWorkflow
user = admin

certificate = /usr/share/euca2ools/certs/cert-hp-aw2-1.pem
verify-ssl = false


hpmcrawford01:bin mcrawford$ *{color:#59afe1}cat ~/.euca/hp-aw2-1.ini{color}* 
; Eucalyptus Region hp-aw2-1

[user hp-aw2-1-admin]
account-id = 630562073671
key-id = <redacted>
secret-key = <redacted>
private-key = /root/.creds/hp-aw2-1/eucalyptus/admin/euca2-admin-76cbf049-pk.pem
certificate = /root/.creds/hp-aw2-1/eucalyptus/admin/euca2-admin-76cbf049-cert.pem

Please view source within the comment block - Confluence seems to be removing the square brackets, but they are there in the correct locations.

I can create a login for you to get into this server, it's from Discover Las Vegas, if you want to poke around personally. But, I'm running my tests from home on both my HP and home macs and/or VMware Fusion CentOS 7.1 VMs which run on each of them.  The euca2ools config has been synched across all 5.

I just noticed one thing when pasting the config file contents. I forgot to update the references to where the private keys and certs are stored when I rsynch'd the ~/.euca directory from the hp-aw2-1 CLC to my management workstations, so the path listed which begins with "/root/.creds" should instead begin with either "/home/mcrawford/.creds on my CentOS VM, or "/Users/mcrawford/.creds" on my macs. That hasn't affected any other commands, but I have not run any image manipulation commands on Mac/non-CLC linux so didn't notice this until just now. Don't know if only the euwatch config load code might see an invalid path and throw an exception, but thought I'd mention that. I will fix now and let you know if that makes a difference.
